title: Romans Chapter 16 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Romans chapter 16 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Romans Chapter 16 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Romans Chapter 16.

questions.question: Who does Paul commend to the believers in Romans 16:1?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:1 states that Paul commends Phebe to the believers as a servant of the church at Cenchrea.

questions.question: According to Romans 16:3, who are described as Paul's helpers in Christ Jesus?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:3 specifically names Priscilla and Aquila as Paul's helpers in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: Where is the church that meets in the house of Priscilla and Aquila, according to Romans 16:5?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:5 instructs believers to greet the church that meets in the house of Priscilla and Aquila.

questions.question: Who is mentioned in Romans 16:7 as being notable among the apostles and fellow prisoners with Paul?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:7 identifies Andronicus and Junia as Paul's kinsmen and fellow prisoners who are notable among the apostles.

questions.question: According to Romans 16:16, how are believers instructed to greet one another?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:16 commands believers to salute one another with a holy kiss as a sign of Christian fellowship.

questions.question: Who wrote the epistle of Romans, as mentioned in Romans 16:22?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:22 states that Tertius wrote the epistle and sends his greetings in the Lord.

questions.question: According to Romans 16:17, what should believers do with those who cause divisions contrary to the doctrine learned?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:17 urges believers to mark and avoid those who cause divisions and offenses contrary to the teachings they have learned.

questions.question: Who is described as a 'chosen in the Lord' along with his mother in Romans 16:13?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:13 mentions Rufus as chosen in the Lord along with his mother, who is also considered like a mother to Paul.

questions.question: What does Romans 16:20 say God will shortly do to Satan?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:20 promises that the God of peace will soon bruise Satan under the feet of the believers.

questions.question: Who is described as a servant of the church at Cenchrea in Romans 16:1?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:1 clearly describes Phebe as a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 16:4 states that Priscilla and Aquila risked their lives for Paul.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:4 affirms that Priscilla and Aquila laid down their own necks for Paul's life, showing great risk and loyalty.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 16:21 mentions that Timotheus is Paul's workfellow and sends greetings.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:21 states that Timotheus, along with others, is a workfellow of Paul and sends greetings to the believers.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 16:18 says that those who cause divisions serve the Lord Jesus Christ.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:18 explains that those causing divisions serve their own belly, not the Lord Jesus Christ, and deceive others with flattering words.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Romans 16:2: 'That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever ______ she hath need of you.'
questions.explanation: Romans 16:2 instructs to assist Phebe in whatever business she needs help with, confirming 'business' as the correct word.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Romans 16:25: 'Now to him that is of power to ______ you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ.'
questions.explanation: Romans 16:25 declares the power of God to 'stablish' believers according to the gospel, making 'stablish' the correct choice.

medium.title: Romans Chapter 16 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Romans Chapter 16 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Romans 16:20, what biblical truth would you share about overcoming adversity?
options: God will bruise Satan under your feet shortly.
You must endure trials alone without support.
Trials mean God has abandoned you.
Only through wealth can you overcome troubles.
questions.correctAnswer: God will bruise Satan under your feet shortly.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:20 assures believers that God of peace will soon crush Satan under their feet, showing divine victory over trials and spiritual adversity. This encourages trust and perseverance (cf. Romans 16:19, 16:25-27).

questions.question: How does Romans 16:17-18 teach us about dealing with division in the church?
options: Avoid those who cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine.
Ignore divisions and hope they resolve themselves.
Join those who cause divisions for greater influence.
Promote personal opinions over doctrine to maintain peace.
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid those who cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:17-18 instructs believers to mark and avoid people who cause divisions and offence against the received doctrine, emphasizing obedience to true teaching and guarding against deception.

questions.question: What example does Romans 16:3-4 give about sacrificial service to others?
options: Priscilla and Aquila laid down their necks for Paul's life.
They refused to help others in need.
They only served when it was convenient.
They focused on their own interests.
questions.correctAnswer: Priscilla and Aquila laid down their necks for Paul's life.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:3-4 highlights Priscilla and Aquilaâ€™s sacrificial risk for Paul's life, demonstrating committed service and courage in ministry, inspiring believers to serve selflessly (cf. Romans 16:2).

questions.question: A believer struggles with serving others consistently. According to Romans 16:2, what encouragement can you offer about helping in ministry?
options: Assist others in whatever business they need help with.
Only help when you feel like it.
Serve only those you know personally.
Wait for others to serve you first.
questions.correctAnswer: Assist others in whatever business they need help with.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:2 encourages believers to receive and assist servants of the church in all their needs, showing the importance of practical support and faithful service in Christian fellowship.

questions.question: What does Romans 16:6 teach about the value of laboring in the Lord?
options: Mary bestowed much labor on the believers.
Labor in the Lord is unimportant.
Only leaders should labor in the church.
Laboring is only for financial gain.
questions.correctAnswer: Mary bestowed much labor on the believers.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:6 commends Mary for her labor, emphasizing that diligent work in service to the church is valuable and worthy of recognition, encouraging believers to serve faithfully.

questions.question: Based on Romans 16:7, how should believers regard those who have been in Christ before them and are noted among apostles?
options: With respect and honor recognizing their early faith and service.
Only value those who appear today.
questions.correctAnswer: With respect and honor recognizing their early faith and service.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:7 refers to Andronicus and Junia as notable among the apostles and longtime believers, teaching us to honor those with enduring faith and significant ministry.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 16:16 teaches that greeting one another with a holy kiss is a practice among the churches of Christ.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:16 instructs believers to greet one another with a holy kiss, reflecting affectionate fellowship and unity within the church community.

questions.question: According to Romans 16:14, how are the brethren with Asyncritus, Phlegon, and others described?
options: They are a group of brethren together.
They are strangers to the church.
questions.correctAnswer: They are a group of brethren together.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:14 lists these individuals together as brethren, emphasizing the importance of community and fellowship among believers.

questions.question: How does Romans 16:9 encourage us regarding helpers in Christ?
options: Urbane is a helper in Christ, showing the value of faithful support.
questions.correctAnswer: Urbane is a helper in Christ, showing the value of faithful support.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:9 salutes Urbane as a helper in Christ, underlining the significance of faithful assistance in ministry and encouraging believers to support one another.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to discern good from evil. What counsel from Romans 16:19 would be helpful?
options: Be wise in what is good and simple concerning evil.
Ignore evil and focus on worldly wisdom.
Avoid all knowledge about good and evil.
questions.correctAnswer: Be wise in what is good and simple concerning evil.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:19 advises believers to be wise toward good and innocent concerning evil, encouraging discernment and steadfastness in faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Romans 16:1 commends ____, who is a servant of the church at Cenchrea.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:1 commends Phebe as a servant of the church at Cenchrea, highlighting her role in ministry and service.

questions.question: What does Romans 16:25-26 reveal about the gospel and the mystery revealed?
options: The mystery was kept secret but now revealed by scripture for obedience of faith.
The gospel is a recent invention.
The mystery remains hidden and unknown.
The gospel is only for the Jewish people.
questions.correctAnswer: The mystery was kept secret but now revealed by scripture for obedience of faith.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:25-26 explains that the gospel's mystery was hidden but is now made known through prophetic scripture for all nations to obey faith, emphasizing evangelism and revelation.

questions.question: How does Romans 16:13 illustrate the biblical virtue of family and fellowship?
options: Rufus is chosen in the Lord, and Paul greets his mother as his own.
Family relationships are irrelevant in the church.
Only spiritual bonds matter, not family.
questions.correctAnswer: Rufus is chosen in the Lord, and Paul greets his mother as his own.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:13 shows Paul recognizing Rufus and warmly acknowledging Rufus's mother as his own, demonstrating the blending of spiritual and familial love in Christian fellowship.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 16:18 warns that those who cause divisions serve their own belly and deceive the simple with good words.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:18 warns against divisive people who serve selfish desires and use flattering speech to deceive, urging believers to be cautious and discerning.

questions.question: What instruction about prayer and blessing is found in Romans 16:24?
options: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Only the elders should pray for the church.
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
questions.explanation: Romans 16:24 closes with a blessing invoking the grace of Jesus Christ upon all, encouraging believers to depend on divine grace through prayer and mutual blessing.

hard.title: Romans Chapter 16 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Romans Chapter 16.

questions.question: Who does Paul commend to the Roman believers as a servant of the church at Cenchrea?
questions.explanation: Paul specifically commends Phebe as a servant of the church at Cenchrea, highlighting her role and asking the church to receive her (Romans 16:1).

questions.question: What is requested of the believers regarding Phebe in Romans 16:2?
options: To receive her in the Lord and assist her in whatever business she needs
To appoint her as church leader
questions.correctAnswer: To receive her in the Lord and assist her in whatever business she needs
questions.explanation: Paul urges the believers to welcome Phebe as is fitting for saints and to help her in any matter she requires, emphasizing her service and support (Romans 16:2).

questions.question: Which couple is described as Paul's helpers who risked their lives for him?
questions.explanation: Paul thanks Priscilla and Aquila for laying down their necks for his life, showing their deep commitment and risking danger (Romans 16:3-4).

questions.question: Who is noted as the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ?
questions.explanation: Epaenetus is identified as the firstfruits of Achaia, implying he was among the earliest converts in that region (Romans 16:5).

questions.question: What characteristic is attributed to Mary in Romans 16:6?
options: She bestowed much labour on us
questions.correctAnswer: She bestowed much labour on us
questions.explanation: Mary is commended for her significant labor and service to Paul and the church (Romans 16:6).

questions.question: Which two individuals are described as notable among the apostles and fellow prisoners with Paul?
questions.explanation: Andronicus and Junia, Paul's kinsmen and fellow prisoners, are noted as being prominent among the apostles, indicating their significant ministry (Romans 16:7).

questions.question: Romans 16:20 contains a promise involving Satan. What is this promise?
options: God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet
Satan will be expelled from heaven
Satan will be given power over nations
questions.correctAnswer: God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence that God will soon defeat Satan, symbolizing victory over evil (Romans 16:20).

questions.question: Which literary device is most clearly illustrated by the greeting of many individuals and households in Romans 16?
questions.explanation: The chapter contains a structured list of greetings to individuals and households, reflecting early Christian community networks and social structure (Romans 16:3-15).

questions.question: In Romans 16:17, Paul warns believers to avoid certain people. What is the reason given?
options: They cause divisions and offenses contrary to the doctrine learned
questions.correctAnswer: They cause divisions and offenses contrary to the doctrine learned
questions.explanation: Paul urges the community to mark and avoid those who cause divisions and oppose the doctrine they have received (Romans 16:17).

questions.question: The phrase 'serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly' in Romans 16:18 refers to what kind of behavior?
options: Selfishness and deception through smooth talk
questions.correctAnswer: Selfishness and deception through smooth talk
questions.explanation: Paul criticizes those who serve their own desires and deceive others with flattering speech, not truly serving Christ (Romans 16:18).

questions.question: Who is identified as the writer of the epistle in Romans 16:22?
questions.explanation: Tertius identifies himself as the one who physically wrote the letter, greeting the recipients in the Lord (Romans 16:22).

questions.question: Which two women are greeted together as laborers in the Lord in Romans 16:12?
questions.explanation: Tryphena and Tryphosa are specifically mentioned together as women who labor in the Lord (Romans 16:12).

questions.question: The greeting 'Salute one another with a holy kiss' in Romans 16:16 reflects what cultural practice?
options: A customary early Christian greeting symbolizing fellowship and unity
questions.correctAnswer: A customary early Christian greeting symbolizing fellowship and unity
questions.explanation: The holy kiss was a common greeting among early Christians, signifying mutual love and unity within the community (Romans 16:16).

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 16:7, Junia is regarded as notable among the apostles and was in Christ before Paul.
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly states that Junia is notable among the apostles and had been in Christ before him, highlighting her early and recognized role (Romans 16:7).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Romans 16:27 gives glory to God through _____ Christ for ever.
questions.explanation: The doxology in Romans 16:27 attributes glory to God through Jesus Christ for eternity.

theological.title: Romans Chapter 16 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Romans Chapter 16 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who is commended by Paul as a servant of the church at Cenchrea?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:1 commends Phebe as a servant of the church at Cenchrea. This highlights the biblical model of women serving in ministry roles (e.g., Phoebe as a deacon-like figure in 1 Timothy 3:11, Priscilla teaching Apollos in Acts 18:26, and Deborah as prophetess in Judges 4:4).

questions.question: According to Romans 16:4, for what did Paul thank Priscilla and Aquila?
options: For laying down their necks for his life
For hosting the church in their house
For preaching the gospel in Rome
questions.correctAnswer: For laying down their necks for his life
questions.explanation: Romans 16:4 states that Priscilla and Aquila laid down their necks for Paul's life, showing sacrificial commitment. This echoes the biblical principle of risking one's life for the gospel (Acts 20:24, 2 Timothy 4:7) and the unity and mutual support among believers (John 15:13).

questions.question: Which person mentioned in Romans 16:7 is noted as being 'of note among the apostles' and a fellow prisoner with Paul?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:7 refers to Andronicus and Junia as notable among the apostles and fellow prisoners with Paul. This affirms early apostolic recognition beyond the Twelve (Luke 6:13, Acts 1:26) and highlights fellowship in suffering for Christ (Philippians 1:29).

questions.question: What instruction does Paul give regarding those who cause divisions and offenses contrary to the doctrine learned?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:17 instructs believers to mark and avoid those who cause divisions and offenses contrary to apostolic teaching. This is consistent with warnings against false teachers in 2 Timothy 3:5, Titus 3:10, and Matthew 18:15-17.

questions.question: What is the motivation of those who cause divisions, according to Romans 16:18?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:18 explains that divisive individuals serve their own belly (i.e., selfish desires), not Christ. This aligns with biblical teaching about false teachers motivated by greed and self-interest (2 Peter 2:1-3, Jude 1:16, Philippians 3:19).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The God of peace shall bruise ______ under your feet shortly.'
questions.explanation: Romans 16:20 proclaims that God will soon bruise Satan under believers' feet, affirming Christ's ultimate victory over evil (Genesis 3:15, Hebrews 2:14, Revelation 20:10). This eschatological hope is central to Christian doctrine.

questions.question: Who wrote the epistle of Romans as identified in Romans 16:22?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:22 identifies Tertius as the scribe who wrote the epistle. This shows the use of amanuenses in biblical letter writing (1 Corinthians 16:21) and the authenticity of the text as a Pauline letter.

questions.question: Which greeting is commanded for believers in Romans 16:16?
options: Salute one another with a holy kiss
questions.correctAnswer: Salute one another with a holy kiss
questions.explanation: Romans 16:16 commands believers to greet one another with a holy kiss, a culturally appropriate sign of Christian brotherly love and unity (1 Corinthians 16:20, 2 Corinthians 13:12, 1 Thessalonians 5:26).

questions.question: What is the significance of Epaenetus as mentioned in Romans 16:5?
options: He is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ
He was a prisoner with Paul
He hosted the church in his house
questions.correctAnswer: He is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 16:5 refers to Epaenetus as the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ, indicating he was likely the first convert in that region. This reflects Old Testament imagery of firstfruits as dedicated to God (Exodus 23:19, Leviticus 23:10) and the spreading of the gospel.

questions.question: Which group is associated with household greetings in Romans 16:10 and 16:11?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:10 and 16:11 mention greetings to those of Aristobulus' and Narcissus' households. This reflects the early Christian practice of house churches and the importance of household faith communities (Acts 16:15, 1 Corinthians 1:16).

questions.question: What does Paul wish for the believers at the end of Romans 16:20?
options: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 16:20 ends with Paul wishing the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ to be with the believers, emphasizing divine favor and empowerment (2 Corinthians 13:14, Ephesians 2:8, Titus 2:11).

questions.question: According to Romans 16:25-26, through what means has the mystery been made manifest?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:25-26 explains that the mystery now revealed was made known through the Scriptures of the prophets, showing fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy (Isaiah 42:6, Daniel 2:44, Jeremiah 31:31-34) and God's sovereign plan.

questions.question: Who among the following is NOT mentioned in the salutations in Romans 16:14?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:14 lists Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and brethren with them, but Epaenetus is greeted earlier in Romans 16:5. This reflects the detailed and personal nature of greetings in the early church.

questions.question: What is the ultimate doxology given in Romans 16:27?
options: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever
Glory to the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever
questions.explanation: Romans 16:27 concludes with the doxology attributing glory to God alone through Jesus Christ forever, affirming the central Christian confession of God's wisdom and Christ's mediatorial role (1 Timothy 1:17, Jude 1:25, Revelation 5:13).

questions.question: Who are identified as Paul's kinsmen and fellow prisoners in Romans 16:7?
questions.explanation: Romans 16:7 identifies Andronicus and Junia as Paul's kinsmen and fellow prisoners, highlighting close relational ties and shared sufferings in the mission (Philippians 1:29, Hebrews 13:3).
